title: So / Such / Too / Enough
description: Слушайте конструкции степени: so, such, too, enough.

tasks.audioText: We arrived at the beach after a long drive. The water was so warm that we jumped in immediately.
tasks.transcript: The water was so warm that we jumped in immediately.

options.text: The water was extremely warm, which made them swim right away.
The water was too cold to swim in.
They decided not to go swimming at the beach.
The water temperature was just average.

tasks.explanation: 'So + adjective + that' shows the degree of warmth was high enough to cause an immediate reaction — they jumped in.

tasks.audioText: The restaurant we visited downtown was remarkable. It was such a delicious meal that we decided to go back the next evening.
tasks.transcript: It was such a delicious meal that we decided to go back the next evening.

options.text: The food was disappointing and they never returned.
The meal was so good they chose to visit the restaurant again.
They only went to the restaurant once and forgot about it.
The meal was average but the service was excellent.

tasks.explanation: 'Such + a/an + adjective + noun + that' emphasizes the quality of the meal. The food quality led to a return visit.

tasks.audioText: My grandfather tried to use the new smartphone we gave him. The text on the screen was too small for him to read without glasses.
tasks.transcript: The text on the screen was too small for him to read without glasses.

options.text: He could read the text perfectly without any assistance.
The font size was excessively small, making it unreadable without spectacles.
He enlarged the text and could read everything easily.
The screen was big enough for comfortable reading.

tasks.explanation: 'Too + adjective + for someone + to do' means excessively. The text was excessively small, preventing reading.

tasks.audioText: The students prepared thoroughly for the final examination. Fortunately, the questions were easy enough for everyone to pass.
tasks.transcript: The questions were easy enough for everyone to pass.

options.text: The exam was too difficult and many students failed.
The exam questions were sufficiently simple that all students succeeded.
Only a few students managed to pass the exam.
The exam was cancelled due to its difficulty.

tasks.explanation: 'Adjective + enough + for someone + to do' means sufficiently. The questions reached the level needed for passing.

tasks.audioText: Elena presented her research findings at the international conference. She spoke so confidently that the audience assumed she was a seasoned professor.
tasks.transcript: She spoke so confidently that the audience assumed she was a seasoned professor.

options.text: Her confident delivery led people to think she was an experienced professor.
She was visibly nervous during the entire presentation.
The audience knew she was a student, not a professor.
She refused to present her research at the conference.

tasks.explanation: 'So + adverb + that' indicates the high degree of her confidence created a false impression about her experience level.

tasks.audioText: The traffic jam on the highway lasted for hours during the holiday weekend. There were such long delays that many people missed their flights.
tasks.transcript: There were such long delays that many people missed their flights.

options.text: The delays were significant enough to cause people to miss their planes.
Everyone arrived at the airport on time despite the traffic.
The traffic moved quickly and there were no delays.
Only one person missed their flight due to the traffic.

tasks.explanation: 'Such + adjective + plural noun + that' emphasizes the severity of the delays and their consequence — missed flights.

tasks.audioText: Jack tried to climb the mountain without proper equipment. The slope was too steep for him to continue safely beyond the midpoint.
tasks.transcript: The slope was too steep for him to continue safely beyond the midpoint.

options.text: He reached the summit without any problems.
The incline was excessively sharp, preventing him from going further safely.
The slope was gentle enough for a comfortable hike.
He gave up at the very beginning of the climb.

tasks.explanation: 'Too + adjective + for someone + to do' expresses excessive degree. The steepness exceeded safe limits.

tasks.audioText: The charity event was a tremendous success this year. They raised enough money to build three new schools in the rural area.
tasks.transcript: They raised enough money to build three new schools in the rural area.

options.text: They collected sufficient funds to construct three schools in the countryside.
They didn't raise enough money for even one school.
They raised money but spent it on other projects.
The charity event was cancelled this year.

tasks.explanation: 'Enough + noun + to do' means a sufficient amount. The donations reached the level needed for three schools.

tasks.audioText: The new employee made a critical error on her first day. It was such an embarrassing mistake that she considered resigning immediately.
tasks.transcript: It was such an embarrassing mistake that she considered resigning immediately.

options.text: Her error was minor and nobody noticed it.
She made a small mistake but was proud of her first day.
The mistake was so humiliating she thought about quitting right away.
She resigned before making any mistakes.

tasks.explanation: 'Such + an + adjective + noun + that' emphasizes how embarrassing the mistake was. It nearly drove her to resign.

tasks.audioText: The children wanted to play football in the park after school. Unfortunately, it was too dark outside for them to play safely.
tasks.transcript: Unfortunately, it was too dark outside for them to play safely.

options.text: They played football in the park until midnight.
The lack of daylight made it unsafe for them to play outside.
The park had bright floodlights for evening games.
The weather was perfect for playing football.

tasks.explanation: 'Too dark for them to play' — 'too' indicates an excessive degree of darkness that prevented safe play.

tasks.audioText: The documentary about ocean pollution was deeply moving. The footage was so shocking that it changed many viewers' habits completely.
tasks.transcript: The footage was so shocking that it changed many viewers' habits completely.

options.text: The film content was extremely disturbing and transformed people's behaviour.
The documentary was boring and nobody watched it.
Viewers found the footage uninteresting and ordinary.
The documentary had no impact on anyone's habits.

tasks.explanation: 'So shocking that' — the extreme degree of the shocking content produced a result: permanent behavioural change.

tasks.audioText: The applicant had impressive qualifications and outstanding references. She was experienced enough to handle the most challenging projects alone.
tasks.transcript: She was experienced enough to handle the most challenging projects alone.

options.text: She lacked the experience to manage difficult projects.
She had sufficient expertise to independently manage the hardest assignments.
She needed constant supervision on every project.
She only worked on simple tasks with a team.

tasks.explanation: 'Adjective + enough + to do' means having a sufficient level. Her experience met the threshold for solo complex work.

tasks.audioText: The summer heatwave broke all temperature records in the region. It was so hot that the roads started to melt in several areas.
tasks.transcript: It was so hot that the roads started to melt in several areas.

options.text: The temperature was moderate and comfortable.
The extreme heat caused road surfaces to soften and deform.
The roads were in perfect condition despite the heatwave.
It was cold enough for the roads to freeze over.

tasks.explanation: 'So hot that' introduces the consequence of extreme heat. The temperature was high enough to physically damage roads.

tasks.audioText: The apartment looked perfect in the online photos. However, it turned out to be too noisy for us to consider living there permanently.
tasks.transcript: However, it turned out to be too noisy for us to consider living there permanently.

options.text: The apartment was quiet and peaceful in reality.
The excessive noise level made the apartment unsuitable for long-term residence.
They moved into the apartment despite the noise.
The apartment matched the online description perfectly.

tasks.explanation: 'Too noisy for us to consider' — the noise exceeded the acceptable level, ruling out permanent residence.

tasks.audioText: The rescue team worked through the night after the earthquake. They showed such incredible bravery that the entire nation praised their efforts.
tasks.transcript: They showed such incredible bravery that the entire nation praised their efforts.

options.text: The rescue team displayed remarkable courage, earning nationwide admiration.
The rescue team was criticised for their poor performance.
Nobody noticed the rescue team's efforts after the earthquake.
The rescue team refused to work during the night.

tasks.explanation: 'Such + adjective + noun + that' emphasizes the extraordinary nature of their bravery and its national impact.

short_description: Конструкции степени: so, such, too, enough.
